kdl.prox.dbvis
Class LayoutStateTransitionFunction

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.dbvis.LayoutStateTransitionFunction
Direct Known Subclasses:
LinearStateTransFcn
public abstract class LayoutStateTransitionFunction
extends java.lang.Object

Supports layout animation via the creation of intermediate VertexLocationFunction instances, given start and end states. The details (linear, radial, etc.) of how the intermediate states are created are up to implementing classes.

Method Detail

calcIntermediateStates

public abstract java.util.List calcIntermediateStates(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph graph,
                                                      edu.uci.ics.jung.visualization.VertexLocationFunction startVertLocFcn,
                                                      edu.uci.ics.jung.visualization.VertexLocationFunction endVertLocFcn,
                                                      int numIntermediateStates)
Creates and returns the intermediate states that animate the layout from startVertLocFcn to endVertLocFcn. Note that it's the implementation's responsibility to ensure that all vertices in either startVertLocFcn or endVertLocFcn appear in all intermediate states. The simplest way to do this is to use locations from endVertLocFcn if there's no entry in startVertLocFcn. Later we may treat added vertices specially, e.g., by fading them in at the animation's end.

Parameters:
numIntermediateStates - number of states to add between start and end. must be >0. (It's up to callers to check.)
Returns:
a List of numIntermediateStates intermediate VertexLocationFunction instances representing animated states between the passed start and end states. NB: does not include the start and end states
